comment.author: 48600109393@N01
comment._content: Not Cologne: the cathedral there is next to the railway station and near a river. This feels vaguely like Brussels, but that's really only a guess.

comment.author: 9161595@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blech] Not Brussels, I think. In modern photos of St. Gudula Cathedral, and from what I see on the Wikipedia page, it has symmetrical towers, and a vaulted window over the front-middle section. This cathedral has a tall column & a short one — possibly due to war damage, but it still looks different than St. Gudula — and there seems to be a round rose window.

comment.author: 9161595@N03
comment._content: Antwerp? The Cathedral of Our Lady seems to be a match — taller tower on the front-left, partiallly-round rose window at the front-middle. And the surrounding buildings look similar. I'm not totally convinced yet, but it's the closest match I've been able to come up with.

comment.author: 18885703@N00
comment._content: Strasbourg! A friend lived just over the road from the cathedral and sent me a postcard; looked familiar, I thought....

comment.author: 52802760@N04
comment._content: Definitely Strasbourg, on the right hand side of the photo you can see the ill river. When was the photo taken?

comment.author: 70713860@N08
comment._content: also the dome of Cologne has two symmetrical towers and a bigger nave.

comment.author: 9161595@N03
comment._content: Yes, Strasbourg Cathedral does seem like a better match than Cathedral of Our Lady in Antwerp: Taller tower on the left than the right, full-round rose window in the middle, two vaulted windows above the rose window, triangular detail under the rose window, etc. And in the background, you can see the north fork of the Ill River, and in the background you can see St. Paul's Church of Strasbourg. Actually, the Bing "birds-eye" view lines up pretty well with the view in this photo, to compare to what the area looks like today — not all that different, for the most part. Was Strasbourg not bombed much during the war?
